As a freelancer, I work with multiple clients at the same time. Managing multiple tasks and ensuring that proper tracking is done is not easy. This is where Asana helps a great deal. It allowed not only to ensure that the project is shared with the respected team members, but also helped me to track the status well. Starting from the allotment to when the task is in progress to completion, it helped me to keep track of every step with ease. The best part was the ability to curate different projects and tasks at the same time. Another helpful feature was the automation. I was not required to constantly check if there was a new allotment or anything. The automates messages and emails ensured that everything was done in time and there were no delays. This helped streamline actions and smooth the entire day's tasks. I was able to integrate it with the existing doc system and clients as well. In fact, when I started using this, I found it very simple to use with no deep tech points that hinder the implementation. I have been using this for almost 2 years now, and I am really happy. Also, the support for any issue was seamless.

I really appreciate how Asana reduces silos across teams and opens up greater transparency on what others are working on. It provides visibility across teams, which I find very beneficial. I also enjoy the easy-to-use interface, which makes it straightforward to keep track of ongoing, upcoming, and completed work all in a centralized place.

My opinion of Asana's digital features and resources is very positive and favorable because it offers ideal business performance for managing all types of tasks and digital work processes, allowing you to establish a professional collaboration space that is extremely useful for business. I can also say that Asana is a very useful business system because it allows you to visualize the progress of all your projects and work goals, facilitating the organization and simplification of all your professional operations.

The platform stands out for its timeline view to anticipate bottlenecks, the implementation of forms to standardize external requests, and its automated rules engine. These tools optimize resource allocation and maintain the team's strategic alignment.

The use of visual dashboards makes it easier to track collections, while portfolio goals align inventory with sales objectives and workflow automation streamlines the approval of critical designs without wasting time.
Clean interface, robust capabilities, affordable project management, effective team collaboration.

Asana is a digital platform that stands out for its digital features and resources for managing your work processes and promoting an advanced and professional business collaboration space. I can also say that Asana is an effective work platform for simplifying work processes and automating tasks to improve your organization's professional results and objectives.

I like Asana's workflows and automations, which I find very impactful and valuable. The integrations with other programs and platforms are really beneficial, making it easy to connect different tools I use. I appreciate that Asana offers customizable forms and fields that suit our project management needs. It's very user-friendly to set up and utilize, and I love how I can set up processes and then 'set and forget' for our other teams. The initial setup was very easy too!

I find Asana easy to use, which is great for our team projects. It really helps with knowing who is doing what and by when. I also love the celebratory finishes when a task is complete, as they are very satisfying. The initial setup was very easy, and I have to say, I'd definitely recommend it to others.

There are several tools and features that worked well on Asana including 1) Assignment creation and tracker - Assign created task to users and track its progress in real-time 2) Prioritize To-Do List - Assign which To-Do task to be complete first before others 3) Recurring daily task - Automating certain task to recreated everyday All this tools made daily task felt easy and implementation process is straightforward.

Asana makes it easy to turn plans into clear, trackable work. I like how quickly you can break down big initiatives into projects, tasks, and subtasks with owners and due dates, then switch views (list, board, timeline) depending on how the team likes to work. The visibility is a big win because everyone can see status, priorities, and blockers without constant meetings.
The fact that they are user-friendly is super nice. I appreciate that they provide templates for us to work with and that they make communication easy in between tasks.
The platform offers seamless visualization through dynamic timelines, allows for organized management of customer request forms, and facilitates direct communication regarding specific tasks.

What I like with Asana is that its very flexible and manageable. You can customize the project plan that suites your needs. It's a one stop shop for a Management platform that comes with Dashboard, Analytics and Automation which I prefer due to our extensive range of projects.
We love that Asana turns emails into actionable, trackable tasks without leaving our and automates key actions with rules. This keeps things moving in the right direction.
Asana helps me organize my monthly tasks, which allows me to stay focused every day.

I really appreciate Asana for its ease of use, which makes it straightforward to manage projects effectively. This simplicity is crucial as it helps our projects stay on track and allows us to move things along quickly without getting bogged down in complexities. I also love the rules feature, which keeps items aligned with where they should be, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks. The reminders for tasks are another standout aspect, as they help keep everyone updated and on schedule. The initial setup of Asana was very easy, which is always a significant advantage when integrating new software into team workflows. Overall, these features contribute to a seamless and efficient task management experience.

What I like most about Asana is the clear visibility of tasks and projects in one place, which helps me quickly understand priorities and deadlines. The easy collaboration features (comments, assignments, notifications) reduce communication chaos and speed up work execution.

I really appreciate how Asana reduces silos across teams and opens up greater transparency on what others are working on. It provides visibility across teams, which I find very beneficial. I also enjoy the easy-to-use interface, which makes it straightforward to keep track of ongoing, upcoming, and completed work all in a centralized place.

I think once the templates are set up, they're pretty easy to use. I also like being able to have a portfolio that has all of our projects for that year in it to more easily look across projects. The templates allow us to track progress on projects and really customize it to our company's specific flow for different conditions. So we have about 10 different common project types that all have slightly different flows, and I'm able to capture that accurately and relevantly with those templates. The portfolio allows us to see key details from a 30,000-foot view of all of our projects, including things like the project name, who's assigned to it, when it's launching, progress, and project type.
- Great for organization and collaboration in large organizations - Allows for multiple views for information allowing user to customize - Helpful for task and project tracking
I like how it helps keep me organized and I'm able to plan campaigns smooth and efficiently.
Strong project management and integration features. Good for small organisations and small teams that require focused collaboration and task management.
I like Asana for creating to-do lists and managing due dates, which is especially useful for marketing and events tasks. I also appreciate the collaborative tasks feature that helps in teamwork.

I like how simple Asana is, yet how in depth I can make it. The home page with upcoming tasks and other widgets helps me stay organized without trying very hard. Setting it up was pretty easy, and once I have one project template made, it's pretty easy to make more.
It is simple, practical and scalable. It's easy to set up.
Asana is a poweeful tool to organise work with teams What i most like is that whatever the topic or field asana can organise tout projects flows The use of ia is also appreciated
I like the ability to see the timeline and understand how tasks impact them. I also like that you can use rules to automate simple tasks in Asana, and I really like that feature.
Asana is easier for task and project management. also helpful for complex projects and team management.
It's easy to use and I find it great for organizing my projects

I appreciate Asana's intuitive interface and customizable workflows, which make seamless task tracking possible for agriculture projects or web development. The AI-powered automations, real-time progress views, and integrations notably boost collaboration efficiency. With its timeline and rules, Asana saves time on complex schedules like soil trials. I find the initial setup straightforward with guided onboarding, templates, and videos, allowing quick account creation and project starts in minutes. Asana pairs seamlessly with other tools like Slack and Google Workspace, enhancing efficiency without creating silos.

I use Asana for project management because it helps with timeline tracking and organization. I particularly like the organization feature, as it allows me to set deadlines and communicate easily with teammates. Everything lives in specific projects, so there's no need to try to find old messages about topics, which makes it incredibly convenient.

I like using Asana to stay on top of our projects and client management without needing to have meetings to update. The ability to collaborate with the team and manage projects is great. It's also nice how Asana lets multiple people manage our clients and communicate effectively. Assigning tasks when needed is straightforward. The initial setup for Asana was very easy.

I like that Asana keeps my team on track and ensures they have steady capacities. It really helps solve that problem for me. I also appreciate the task templates because we have a lot of repetitive work, and they make it easy to execute. The Asana trainings were really helpful during the initial setup, even though there was a bit of a learning curve.
The UI is beautiful and most importantly it isn't sluggish.
What I like best about Asana is that it makes it simple to see who’s doing what, by when, and what’s stuck.
it helps me to keep everything organized and keep me on schedule.
Helpful for project management at a basic level

Its easy to create portfolios of projects and from a project management perspective, its an effective tool. There are some good automations, which are helpful (although annoying you have to upgrade for some which would be very useful). I also like that I can easily create dashboards and templated.
Fairly clear project layout, tasks and reports
board view is nice for planning and tracking work on a two week cadence.

Our whole team is on it, so it is a way to track our histories. I also think the AI is helpful in identifying where the unread notifications are or if there are comments that you still need to respond to.
I am not sure what I like best, as I have not had a great experience.
Very comprehensive and flexible task management solution, if you're on a high enough paid plan
I like the visual aspects of Asana. Some of the language used are not as intuitive
Organizational tools weren't bad, but nothing special or life changing.

I know I'm probably in the minority here but we passed on Asana as our PM software. It has some robust features like workflow automation and dynamic reporting but the learning curve is too steep for a lot of our users.
Now that you ask, I don’t know that I like anything . The ability to nest and organize tasks. But so many features are buggy or broken or workers helpful and then duscontinued
Nothing unique but generous free plan with essential features
It does what is does semi-well. A generally OK experience and task manager

Depth of outside independent support available. Also, hiring new staff has used Asana more than most other project management software in the past. They offer a month-to-month pay option, so you don't have to get locked in when you decide to move to a different service.
The best thing is that it allows you to add collaborators outside your organization. The free plan is a good way to start managing your projects but it could be optimazed for better UX
Asana became slow and confusing as our projects grew larger, and the pricing didn't justify the value for our team.
